newsitem.title: USA: Help at Home says investors take stakes.
newsitem.headline: Help at Home says investors take stakes.

text.p: Help At Home Inc said Thursday it received notice that Robertson, Stephens & Co Investment Management LP acquired a 29.3 percent stake in it.
Help At Home also said it received notice that Heartland Advisors Inc and certain of its affiliates have acquired a 5.3 percent stake in it.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Robertson, Stephens reported beneficial ownership of 718,535 shares and share equivalents, purchased in the ordinary course of investment, Help at Home said.
In a separate SEC filing, Heartland Advisors said it has beneficial ownership of 100,000 shares, purchased in the ordinary course of investment.
Help At Home provides in-home support services for the elderly and disabled. The company provides services from 26 locations in Illinois, Missouri, Mississippi, Indiana and Alabama.
